incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

One remaining application host had a broken cable which has now been repaired, and the region is now fully back online.
Total unavailability was 45 minutes (2024-05-13 21:00 - 21:45 UTC) for several servers in the region, and ~19 hours (2024-05-13 21:00 - 2024-05-14 15:50 UTC) for one application host.
Our datacenter provider has confirmed a network switch failure affecting a portion of hosts in this region, and is working on a resolution.
We are seeing a partial recovery of services in this region, some application hosts in this region are still unavailable.
We're investigating a network issue affecting the BOG region.
The metrics system has finished processing its backlog and the service is fully operational again.
A fix has been applied and metrics are once again being processed. They will continue be delayed until the system finishes processing the accumulated backlog.
We are currently investigating an issue affecting application metrics.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Network operations in SJC may encounter delays leading to timeouts, both for Machines operating in the region and for API requests in the region. We are working with our partners to identify the cause.

On 2024-05-08 13:20 UTC, we deployed a load-balancer update to `ams` that caused registry pushes with large image layers to get stuck, impacting new app builds from this region for ~48 hours. On 2024-05-10 12:30 UTC, this update was deployed globally, impacting new app builds for ~1 hour. We rolled back the update on 2024-05-10 13:30 UTC and the issue is now resolved.

incidents.name: Users are unable to deploy their apps

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are moving App Builders from AMS to IAD to mitigate the impact of the possible network problems.
We are investigating possible upstream network problems with s3
Our suspected fix was not successful - continuing to investigate other avenues
We're monitoring a suspected fix to the registry
Investigating issues relating to registry/tokens with DFW, and issues in CDG
Symptoms look like docker layer uploads hang while pushing the layers. We're investigating this issue!
This issue has been resolved
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
All services are operational and we are monitoring our telemetry.
We are repairing the last handful of physical servers.

A small percentage of physical servers have experienced abnormally high memory utilization, resulting in intermittent failures for the machines they are hosting. We are working to repair the problem and restore service to affected machines.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified an issue with generating and verifying tokens. The team is working on a fix now.
We are seeing elevated API errors. We're currently investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Most workers are back online and machines on those workers are operating. We are monitoring the final few workers to ensure they start and machines become operational.
Data center power has come back online. We are working to get all workers in sjc operational.

Some workers in sjc region are currently offline. We are working with our data center vendor to investigate the issue.

Machines that are on affected hosts in sjc are not accessible and shutdown. We recommend deploying in other regions if you are able.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.
All errors have been fixed.
We've deployed another fix and are seeing signs of recovery

The iad region is still having issues, which are affecting the platform. We're investigating and will continue to update here.

Machines are not able to start. The dashboard is not loading.
We have deployed a fix to the vast majority of our hosts. We are still working on a small number of remaining hosts.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are observing elevated errors and connectivity issues across Fly.io

We experienced a temporary outage in the wireguard mesh connecting all of our physical hosts which resulted in a number of internal systems losing connectivity with each other. The mesh has been repaired, but some regions required manual intervention, notably: AMS, BOM, CDG, HKG, IAD, MIA, SJC, SYD, YYZ. The following was impacted (a non-exhaustive list, this was a full network outage): fly token validation (including github actions and flyctl auth), 6pn networking calls, log delivery, routing requests to user machines.
We have identified a small number of physical servers that are still impacted and are recovering them.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are observing elevated errors and connectivity issues across Fly.io
This incident has been resolved.
We have confirmed an upstream network issue affecting traffic routing through the Pacific Northwest region.
We are investigating a network issue primarily affecting the SEA and HKG regions.
This incident has been resolved
A fix has been implemented upstream by our providers and we're monitoring the network.

We've identified that the network issues in MAD are affecting remote builds in this region as well. 
We continue investigating with our provider in the region to get the issue identified and resolved.
We are investigating a networking-related issue in our MAD region workers. This is manifesting as timeouts for some customer's apps trying to reach external services.
This issue is resolved.
Metrics propagation has normalized and missing metrics are being backfilled.
We've identified and applied a potential fix. We're currently monitoring the results. Some metrics continue to be delayed
We're investigating delays in metrics distribution. Some apps may see delays in their metrics showing up on fly-metrics.net
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are currently investigating this issue.
If you are experiencing this issue, a reploy/update might fix it while we work to resolve this.
This issue is resolved
Customer log access has been restored. We are continuing to monitor logging functionality.
We are currently investigating an issue with logs from machines being unavailable.
This incident is now resolved. After the fix was deployed, the managed metrics websites are responding swiftly now.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
This incident is now resolved. After the fix was deployed, 502 responses rates are back to baseline.
We've deployed a fix that recovered the machines affected by this incident.

This issue is a fallout from previous incident.  For a solution, please refer to https://community.fly.io/t/fly-app-servers-down/19229/40

We are working on finding a fix for the stuck machines.

incidents.name: Creating new machines or updating existing machines may error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Creating new machines should work fine. Some machines may be stuck in an invalid state. We are working towards unclogging those.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
This incident has been resolved.
We are investigating capacity issues in our IAD region.
A fix has been implemented and log in behaviour has returned to normal.
We've identified the cause of the issue and are deploying a fix.

We're investigating errors logging in to the Fly.io dashboard using the email /password form at fly.io/app/sign-in. 

Log ins via Github and Google SSO are not impacted.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
IPv6 connectivity may be disrupted for some apps in the DFW region. We are currently investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and deployed to all regions.
We have identified the cause of the issue. We are currently working on the fix.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: Our network is fully operational and we continue to monitor to ensure DDoS mitigations remain effective.

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: We're actively mitigating an on-going DDoS attack to our anycast ranges. You may continue to experience some elevated network latency in isolated regions as we adjust our defenses.

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: Network issues in LAX, ORD and ATL have been identified and be causing high latency or unresponsiveness for apps in those regions

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: Network issues in LAX/ORD/ATL may be causing high latency or unresponsiveness for apps in those regions

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The output of flyctl logs will not display recorded logs since 22:00 UTC. Once run, flyctl logs will pick up new logs being broadcast live, but they will not be present if flyctl logs is run again. All logs are present in the interactive log search available through the dashboard. The cause has been identified and a fix is being designed.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. All logs should be live streaming in all regions.
There are still intermittent live logging issues in at least the FRA region. Log searching via Quickwit should still be operational.
This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to investigate this issue.

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: Network issues in LAX and SJC have been identified and be causing high latency or unresponsiveness for apps in those regions

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: Network issues in LAX/SJC may be causing high latency or unresponsiveness for apps in that region

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - LAX - Los Angeles, California (US)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All users should now be seeing their logs. Please email support or post in the community forum if not.
There was a problem with an internal component and a fix is being deployed. Logs may still be undelivered in certain regions.
Some users may be experiencing issues receiving logs. Currently investigating.

incidents.name: Routing Issues and App Logs Delayed

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're monitoring recovery of the observability infrastructure and edge servers. We still have configuration propagation delays across regions.
The configuration change has been applied. We're monitoring recovery of the observability infrastructure and edge servers.
The delayed log ingestion has overwhelmed our edge servers. Applications may not be accessible due to that. We are applying a configuration change to mitigate the impact.
Our observability infrastructure was experiencing delayed log ingestion, a fix has been put in place and we are actively monitoring.
This incident has been resolved.
We have confirmed a network issue in the Tokyo, Japan (nrt) region. Some applications in this region may have interrupted network connectivity.
This incident has been resolved.
We're actively adding more capacity to our MAD region. Scaling events and blue-green deployments may fail until this is resolved. Please consider scaling in nearby regions (LHR, CDG, AMS).
This incident has been resolved.
We're monitoring recovery of our primary logging cluster.

Hardware replacement for our primary logging cluster is underway. Stored logs remain delayed or missing until this process is complete. Live following of logs and log-shipper functionality will not be impacted by this process.
Live following of logs, as well as log-shipper functionality is now restored. Stored logs remain delayed or missing while we work towards recovery of our primary logging cluster.
We continue to investigate this issue. Logs for most customer apps are delayed or missing at this time.
Our observability infrastructure is currently experiencing delayed log ingestion

This incident has been resolved.
There was a power disturbance at a SJC datacenter that caused a network switch and several servers to be rebooted. Some applications hosted in this region were offline from 22:56 - 23:26 UTC.
Network connectivity has been restored.
We have confirmed a network issue in the San Jose, California (sjc) region. Some applications in this region may have interrupted network connectivity.
We have identified and rolled out a fix
We rolled back a change that broke our API and consequently our UI, CLIs. We are seeing things mitigating and are monitoring before we resolve.
We believe we've identified the issue and are working to rollback
We're currently investigating an increase in 500 responses from our GraphQL API which is also affecting our CLI and UI.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
We are performing emergency network maintenance in HKG. We expect network connectivity to be unavailable for approximately 15 minutes.
We are working to resolve intermittent connectivity issues in HKG
This incident has been resolved.
An application routing fix has been deployed, and metrics query response times have returned back to normal levels.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We're investigating an issue accessing application metrics.
This incident has been resolved.
We have routed around the bad circuit and are monitoring.
We have identified a bad circuit and are investigating
We are currently investigating slow network connections in LHR.
This incident has been resolved.
Some security updates affected internal communication of services causing some API requests to fail.
We are currently investigating.
Routing is normalized.
Routing is normalized and we're monitoring to ensure traffic is reaching the correct regions.
We're investigating possible routing problems, causing reset connections (visible as ECONNRESET or "Failed to fetch" client side and "client closed connection" in server logs).
This incident is resolved.
We've deployed a fix for this problem and are monitoring to ensure everything is working normally.

We've identified the cause of this issue. We've determined it's most likely to affect deploys of newly-created organizations and/or applications. It might affect deploys even on old applications with builder failures. A mitigation for the latter is to use --local-only when deploying. Full resolution is underway.

Machine creation operations, including deploys, currently fail with "could not launch machine: failed to launch VM: failed to get org". Other operations such as destroy work normally. Currently-running machines continue to work normally.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating an issue with the API that involves deploying, creating, and updating machines.

incidents.name: Application logs are not currently available

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The logs issue has been identified and we are continuing to investigate.
A fix is rolling out across the fleet but may take some time to unblock application logs as we run through the backlog of hosts. We are continuing to monitor as logs become available.
The logs issue has been identified and a fix is being rolled out across the fleet.
Customer logs are not currently available - investigating.
This incident has been resolved.
We are performing a maintenance on our state management database. Recently updated resources may take longer to be accessible
This incident has been resolved.
We identified the faulty component and are attempting remediation. Users connected to WireGuard gateways may see issues with connectivity for a brief time.
Some users may see an "error: context timeout exceeded" error when deploying apps. We are investigating.

incidents.name: API errors with secrets and volumes

incident_updates.body: An issue with the secrets service which was affecting API requests was resolved.
We are currently investigating issues with setting secrets or launching machines or volumes that use secrets

incidents.name: Issues allocating new public IPv6 addresses

incident_updates.body: We are resolved
We believe we are mitigated. Monitoring for any further issues,
We believe we've identified the issue and are working on a fix.
We are investigating issues some customers are having allocating new public IPv6 addresses for their apps.
We’ve applied several mitigations to account for an increase in load on our primary DB which has resulted in the API requests no longer timing out.
We've mitigated the issue and are continuing to monitor for increased error rates.
We're aware of elevated time outs to our GraphQL API.
